intro: Glomera reineckeana, commonly known as the Reinecke's glomera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
